description: Unique identifier for this portal configuration record.
Default state prefilled for request location when users submit a new request.
Default city prefilled for request location.
Display pattern used to format dates shown to users (e.g., submission and promise dates).
Format string used to generate or display work request identifiers; exact usage may vary, confirm with SME.
Default number of days added to determine the promised completion date after submission.
Indicates whether submissions must be approved before becoming active or converting to a work order.
Controls sending a satisfaction survey to the requester when a request is closed.
Enables human verification on the submission form to reduce spam.
Controls whether contextual help or instructions are displayed in the portal.
Base URL where this portal is hosted and accessed by users.
Allows request submissions from mobile devices or mobile apps.
Contact phone number displayed on the mobile view for assistance.
Distance threshold used for automatic duplicate detection based on proximity of reported locations; confirm units with SME.
Time window used to detect duplicates based on how recently similar requests were submitted.
Enables automatic duplicate checking to flag or merge matching submissions.
Default latitude used to center maps or prefill location for new requests.
Default longitude used to center maps or prefill location for new requests.
Enables integration with Google Maps for location selection and display.
Human-readable title or description presented to users for this portal.
User who created this portal configuration record.
Timestamp when this portal configuration record was created.
User who last updated this portal configuration record.
Timestamp when this portal configuration record was last updated.
Geospatial boundary defining the service area in which requests can be placed; used for geofencing/validation.
Most recently assigned work request number used to continue sequential numbering.
Grouping code linking requests from this portal to an external or extended request group; confirm with SME.
Notification template used to inform stakeholders that a submission requires approval.
Notification template used when a request is closed.
Notification template used when a new request is created.
Notification template used when a request is denied.
Notification template used when the promised completion date is changed.
Notification template used for requester password reset messages.
Notification template used for supervisor alerts or escalations.
Notification template used when a work order is created from a request.
Controls whether entered street addresses must validate against a reference street database.
Allows submissions without user authentication.
Allows submissions from the general public, not just internal staff.
Marks this configuration as the systemâ€™s default portal.
Flag indicating integration with a companion citizen/mobile app; confirm exact platform with SME.
Default category or group assigned to new requests submitted through this portal.
Controls whether a map is shown for selecting or viewing request locations.
Indicates that describing the issue is mandatory before submission.
Controls visibility of motor pool request options; confirm exact scope with SME.
Enables single sign-on so users can authenticate via an external identity provider.
